Hi @hedythedev 

`black --check .` is probably fine.

I think you're probably correct in separating check and format in the makefile. But bear in mind that `pythonpackage.yml` calls  `make format`, so with your change it should probably be `make format-check`.

Agree about mentioning it in CONTRIBUTING.md 

I recently came across `https://pre-commit.com/`. Maybe we should consider that?

I’ve heard about pre-commit but never maintained a project that uses that, but tried to work with it when contributing to another project. Since I use online environments heavily it needs `--user` Installs which my thing wont work, so it might cause some problems to people unfamiliar with it. That said though, IMO it doesn’t really matter if pre-commit is used because they can always choose not to install the hooks and run the checks themselves manually.

Thanks @hedythedev 

So you use a cloud based IDE?

Recently for the past week or so yes 😁

Also really excited for github codespaces to go public, after that it will be much easier
